attributes.action: Introduce ‘Digital Judgement’ as a CORE topic in the National Curriculum.
attributes.background: Some outcomes of the internet boom are calls to fight, extremism terrorism and hatred and hoaxes, via new social media propaganda.  These threaten our society and children. It MUST be a priority now to arm our children with 'Digital Judgement'; the skill to cope with the threat of the digital world.
attributes.additional_details: Society is easily seduced by online propaganda, drawn towards anti-social intolerant attitudes and behaviours towards the extremes making governance virtually impossible and increasing risks and costs to individuals and communities.  Being able to recognise and resist internet threats is a crucial skill, but getting increasingly harder. We MUST start NOW educating our children to become ‘critical' users of the social media they will grow up with, and which will shape our society for evermore.

attributes.action: Ring-fence current social service and care spending.
attributes.background: A failure to ring-fence government and local council spending on social care and services has allowed spending cuts to leave such services underfunded, and unable to meet the needs of the entire population - which can be seen in numerous failures of care for children, the elderly, and the disabled.
attributes.additional_details: Only last year adult social care regulators were reported to be receiving up to 150 reports of abuse per day - which Andrea Sutcliffe (Head of Adult Social Care) attributed to service failures, caused by underfunding. Moreover, children Trae-Bleu Layne, Rio Ross, Keanu Williams and Khyra Ishaq (four examples of many) - all died due to a lack of an organised response towards their welfare by social services - which may have been provided had funding been available to plan such a response.

attributes.action: Scrap 9-1 GCSE's for the current year 10 (leaving in 2k17)
attributes.background: The current year 10 in the UK will have a mixture of letters and numbers for their GCSE's and they are having huge levels of pressure to complete the syllabus for english and maths on time and revise before sitting the exams.
attributes.additional_details: At some schools, students are stressing because they will not be able to study and revise well enough in the short period of time. If the 9-1 GCSE's are not running for the current year 10's 2k16, then it will reduce the stress of students not getting very high grades

attributes.action: Call For A 2nd EU Referendum If A Good EU Withdrawal Agreement Cannot Be Made
attributes.background: The United Kingdom voting to leave the European Union triggers Article 50 of the Lisbon Treaty. We want to decide if we should remain part of the European Union based upon the nature of the withdrawal agreement.
attributes.additional_details:
A Brexit triggers Article 50 of the Lisbon Treaty. The European Council will conclude the this withdrawal arrangement based upon a qualified majority vote. A large portion of the United Kingdom electorate were misled into believing a favourable withdrawal agreement is relatively certain. 

We believe in informed democracy. We believe that we the British people should be able to decide whether or not our country leaves the EU based upon facts that we can confirm. Not contingent truths.

attributes.action: Voting Results Transparency Through An Update of the Voting System
attributes.background: We call for an updated voting system, British people register once, when the time comes to vote they take a unique identifier with them to a local polling station where they can log onto an electronic terminal and submit their vote. The public should be able to view all the votes for transparency.
attributes.additional_details: Many will argue their anonymity will be breached through transparency, however this very anonymity has the potential to be used, to manipulate the general public to remain in a closed and unknown voting system, where the possibility of corruption of votes will remain. Transparency removes uncertainty and creates trust, a notion that perhaps will restore a small portion of much needed faith in our countries politics.

attributes.action: Remove ethics questions from science exams at all levels of education.
attributes.background: For most people ethics are easy, but for psychopaths they are often an ungraspable concept. This does not make them evil, most psychopaths are just disadvantaged and live peacefully otherwise. However, I feel it is unfair to put a minority at such a disadvantage purely because of how they were born.
attributes.additional_details: Psychopaths are a relatively large minority in the UK, which means that a significant quantity of students are completely unable to answer questions regarding ethics through no fault fo their own. I feel that this is discrimination against certain people and should be changed to give them a fair chance at an exam just like anybody else. Exams are vital to success in later life and being put at a disadvantage just because the exam board doesn't consider everyone is very unfair in my opinion.

attributes.action: Present only balanced arguments to the public for country wide referendums
attributes.background: There are so many factors that go into something like the EU referendum and so many points of view, from infinitely many sources, that facts are lost/blurred in a "shouting match" between parties attempting to court our vote with ill or misinformed information.
attributes.additional_details: Using the EU referendum as an example again, we see too many "scare tactics" presented openly as "fact" by both leave and remain campaigners. This has led to many of us being left confused and feeling like we are backing the party with the loudest voice. I think one of two things would help everyone if another situation such as this should arise; either campaigns should always be presented with for AND against points equally or an independent analyst should present one document with all FACTS.

attributes.action: Make it illegal for a vehicle Driver or Passenger  to Smoke with a Window Down !
attributes.background: Drivers & passengers that smoke with a window down hold their cigarettes outside of the vehicle with ash & smoke going into the eyes/faces of following motorcycles, bicycles etc. This can blind people in following vehicles causing accidents & fatalities. This should be made illegal on safety grounds
attributes.additional_details:
People have been blinded on several occasions by moving vehicles/cars/vans & stationary hgvs by ash blown into thier eyes. 
Drivers appear oblivious to the impact of their actions on other road users. For a driver this is also effectively 'not in control of the vehicle' driving with one hand. The main problem is the holding of a cigarette outside the vehicle where the forward motion or wind carries the ash into the eyes of other road users. The way to enforce would be to ensure no external smoke

attributes.action: All Police to be equipped with Naloxone kits to save lives
attributes.background:
Naloxone is a medication used to block the effects of opioids, especially in overdose.

I have provided a link to show how many Police Departments in America carry Naloxone and times it has saved lives. 

http://www.nchrc.org/law-enforcement/us-law-enforcement-who-carry-naloxone/

attributes.action: Ban Spithoods in all UK Institutions and Police Stations
attributes.background: After watching a news article about Spithoods being used on people in Pokice Custody, I was incensed at the thought of such barbaric items being used in 21st Britain. It upset me so much that i felt the need to start this petition to get them banned altogether. Just the thought of them made me ill
attributes.additional_details: These could cause a fatality in some cases especially where people suffer from claustraphobia it coukd cause asthma patients to struggle to breath and the list goes on

attributes.action: Award allied military veterans an honour 70 years after their conflict finishes.
attributes.background: France has been awarding the Chevalier in the Ordre de la Légion d’Honneur, equivalent to a British MBE, to veterans 70 years after a conflict finishes. As our veterans are now effectively ambassadors to the younger generations, British and allied veterans should be recognized in similar fashion.
attributes.additional_details:
Grand Chancery of the Legion of Honor 
http://www.legiondhonneur.fr/en

The application for the Legion D’Honneur for British Veterans
https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/d-day-70-application-form-for-award-of-the-legion-dhonneur

British Legion press release: LEGION D'HONNEUR AWARD FOR D-DAY VETERANS
http://support.britishlegion.org.uk/app/answers/detail/a_id/1308/~/legion-dhonneur-award-for-d-day-veterans

attributes.action: Reduce funding for the BBC by the production cost of the new Top Gear.
attributes.background: The new format of Top Gear does not show value for money for the UK TV Licence payer. The new format is focused on capturing the US market and the revenue it can receive. The BBC should then have the cost of the new format production reduced from it's annual funding.
attributes.additional_details: The new format of Top Gear does not show value for money for the UK TV Licence payer. The new format is focused on capturing the US market and the revenue it can receive. This is in effect is commercial TV and therefore should not have to be funded by the public purse. The BBC should then have the cost of the new format production reduced from it's annual funding until a UK audience based format is produced for the UK TV Licence payer.

attributes.action: Bring back maintenance grant for 2016?
attributes.background: After this rise of tution fees to 9000 students already going to be in a debt of 18000. If you scrap maintenance grant then thats double debt every year making the debt nearly 32000 this putting of students for going into higher education and those who do will be I debt for most of life.

attributes.action: Category D (bus) license holders to be upgraded to class 2 license for free.
attributes.background: Due to the similar size of vehicles and weight of vehicles category D (bus) show be allowed to drive class 2 vehicles.

attributes.action: Amend the law on stamp duty on your main residence when you own a second home
attributes.background: If you cohabit and separate and want to transfer the main residence to your sole name you have to pay 3% stamp duty on your equity share coupled with your portion of any remaining mortgage when you own a second property.  This law does not apply if you are married so discriminates people cohabiting.
attributes.additional_details:
Stamp duty was paid when the house was originally purchased so how can you pay this again when you are not moving?
Why does the rule not apply if you were to sell the property?
Why does being married mean you are exempt?
The revenue state this is because you are increasing your share of property you own?
Surely the additional stamp duty should only be on the increase in market value/equity of the property over and above what you originally paid?

attributes.action: Make older homes comply with new building regs if proven harmful to occupants
attributes.background: In the past new homes were built to conserve energy, one way to this was to make them airtight. A side affect of this was insufficient ventilation, regulations have been changed in recent years to prevent this but older homes continue to harm their occupants with high levels of indoor pollution.
attributes.additional_details:
For 10 years I have owned a shared ownership leasehold apartment that suffers from insufficient ventilation, it has been proved to have very poor airflow but as it was given a completion certificate by the local authority I have been unable to persuade the Housing Association or the Freeholder to allow me to change the windows. 
For 6 years I was poisoned by excessive levels of CO2 that built up in my property while I was sleeping, 4 years ago I left my home and I am still waiting for resolve.

attributes.action: Increase SFE loan for volunteer placement year students in the UK
attributes.background: SFE is there to help students afford their university studies, however the amount offered for a volunteer (unpaid) placement year is considerably lower, making it hard for students to afford living costs. Universities are pushing for students to take placement years yet SFE is making it unaffordable
attributes.additional_details:
Universities and SFE offer varying amounts ranging from £2000 to £2500. According to the NUS average living costs for a student in the UK is £13,388 for living costs
(£6,143 for rent, £1,956 for food, £316 for household goods, £65 for insurance, £2,074 for personal items, £1,524 for travel and £1,310 for leisure).

attributes.action: Vendors withdrawing from sales should incur penalties to cover purchasers costs.
attributes.background:
Because of our Vendors decision to withdraw the sale of his property on the day of exchange, we have incurred searches costs,  legal and surveyors fees and now rental costs while we find another property.
We felt obliged to continue, our buyers are due to become parents.

attributes.action: Change the Childcare Act and enable childcare vouchers to be given for relatives
attributes.background: The Department For Education (DFE) allows some parents to claim free childcare for 2 years and for all 3 year olds. At the moment a relative of the child cannot claim this free childcare even if they are an approved childcare provider.
attributes.additional_details: According to the Childcare Act 2006 Childcare is deemed as care for a child that is not provided by a relative. There are many registered childminders who look after their relatives and therefore cannot claim the 15 hours free childcare. However if the child goes to a nursery where a relative works they are allowed to claim free childcare. If a childcare provider is registered and looking after a relative they should be entitled to claim for the free vouchers.

attributes.action: Child Maintenance Options(CSA) to charge a one off fee instead of monthly fees
attributes.background: I feel parents are penalised if they cant work together they shouldn't have to pay continual fees in order to have help in receiving the financial assistance for their child. An initial larger one off payment would be better.When deducting fees monthly the kids are losing out long term its not fair.
attributes.additional_details: I understand that a fee will have to be charged as alot of work goes in to setting up the case but an initial one off fee will be better to help cover the costs.Alot of parents cant work together for a range of reasons including domestic violence,why should our children pay the price of them not being able to work together,they lose out receiving less funds towards their upbringing and quality of life.A one off larger fee should be done to start a new case and carry on maintaining existing ones

attributes.action: Suspend tolls on the M6Toll when roadworks are in place on the M6
attributes.background: M6 roadworks bring traffic chaos to millions of drivers and businesses. More works are halving the capacity and reducing speed to 40mph for 6 months.  Relieve the stress to motorists and cost to business by suspending toll fees on M6Toll during roadworks affecting J11 to J4a.

attributes.action: Call for greater public scrutiny of how police forces are spending public money
attributes.background: Following the Hillsborough verdict, where 96 people died, greater scrutiny and reform is required to look at how public money is spent by the police to defend themselves and cover up their failure and mistakes. The Hillsborough victims’ families were denied the truth and struggled 27 yrs for justice
attributes.additional_details: The current system is unfair, unequal/bias against the victims and their families who deserve justice. Scrutiny and reform is required to monitor and stop those in the police and across our public services abusing public money to cover up their failures. The Hillsborough disaster proves how deep the covering up goes and how those in our public services do not admit their guilt but continue to pervert the course of justice. The government must act to hold those who abuse public funds accountable

attributes.action: Standardize the delay repay system formula across all train franchises.
attributes.background: Not all train companies pay out the same percentage compensation per journey for delayed/cancelled trains to season ticket holders. Southeastern divide the amount by 546 journeys a year yet Southern divide the cost by 464 journeys a year. All train companies should have to follow the same formula.
attributes.additional_details:
https://www.southeasternrailway.co.uk/contact-us/delay-repay/more-information/ - Annual season ticket counts as 1/546.

http://www.southernrailway.com/your-journey/passengers-charter/ - On the passenger charter leaflet an annual season ticket counts as 1/464.

attributes.action: Stop volunteers doing mock interviews in schools, use paid Career Coaches
attributes.background:
action to promote consistent and proactive approach to career  coaching in schools /colleges. 
Each student to receive a career coaching programme to suit.
Mock interviews depends who is "interviewing". coaches should be paid for their skills and talents.
attributes.additional_details:
Coaching is not a career advisor  in another guise, most people have bad memories of advice in schools and the advice was useless for  most people.
Career Coaching is about the individual.

attributes.action: The NHS to provide meals for staff, including staff at Queen's Medical Centre.
attributes.background: I want the NHS to provide meals for the staff at queens medical centre including agency staff that work at qmc. The staff work hard everyday and do not get a option whether they would like a meal, I'm writing this petition to ask you to get the nhs to provide meals for staff at the qmc.
attributes.additional_details: At the present moment if the staff at the queens medical centre eat the hospital food they get fired instantly, At fast food places such as McDonald's, burger king ect the staff get free meals, meanwhile the staff at queens medical centre save people lives everyday and they don't get the option. I would like the nhs to provide ethier free meals for the hospital staff or charge £1.00 per meal as they deserve it.

attributes.action: Allow all British Overseas Territories Citizens become full British/UK citizens
attributes.background: I am from Turks and Caicos Islands, a British overseas territory located in the Caribbean. British Overseas Territories Act 2002 did not allow  all British Overseas Territories Citizens to become full British citizen. I would like all members of parliament to review and vote on this.
attributes.additional_details: Parliament  should amend the British Nationality Act 1981 and the British Overseas Act 2002 to allow all British overseas territories become full British/UK citizens.

attributes.action: Make it a requirement for all betting shops to have bandit screens
attributes.background: In recent months there has been a torrent of staff being raped, held at knife point and zero security for the staff working in betting shops and nothing has been done about this. It's time companies that run betting shops are held accountable for the safety of the staff they employ!
attributes.additional_details: Since the release of the new regulations from the government for gambling more and more staff are being put at risk by their employers including a staff member who was raped in a store and more recently members of staff and the public being held at knife point is becoming more and more frequent. No measures have been put in place to protect the staff. One member of staff was held at gunpoint while a robbery took place. It needs to be addressed NOW before people die!!

attributes.action: A referendum to change our system of electing a representative
attributes.background: A call for a referendum to change our system of electing a representative with 3 options either keep our current system which is First past the post or change to either Alternative vote or the Single transferable vote to ensure a more representative Parliment/Democracy.

attributes.action: Make all retail and commercial premises prominently display their street numbers
attributes.background: Most shops and commercial premises fail to display their street numbers at all, making it very difficult to find them by address. This adds to high street congestion, pollution and potential for accidents by distracted drivers. Prominently displaying their street number should be a legal requirement

attributes.action: Fund the NHS by increasing income-tax by 2 pence in the pound.
attributes.background: The NHS is on its knees, it requires reorganisation which means a lot more funding than is currently available from the Government purses.  We ALL benefit from the NHS and we CANNOT allow it to fall 'unfit for purpose'. "Once it has gone - there will be no turning back"
attributes.additional_details:
The NHS should be free service to all UK citizens and that is true in most cases however, 'nothing is free in life'. If we want to be able to visit a doctor when we feel ill or go to Casualty, when our child or other loved one has suffered a serious injury or perhaps receive cancer treatment or other medical care - maybe we need to call an ambulance in an emergency, we need to keep and fund the NHS.

To keep this service the NHS has to be paid for!!!

Working people could pay 2 pence in the pound  & those of us receiving State benefits & pensions to have 2% deducted at source.

 I want my grandchildren to be able to have access to a good NHS but we must all do our bit to pay for. 

Please sign this petition to help us achieve it.

attributes.action: Compensate overseas pensioners re post Brexit drop in the Pound.
attributes.background: We, pensioners aged 72 & 79 (ex RAF- now 70% disabled)  left Britain in 1991 to go and live in France. After 19 years we joined our daughter in Germany. We know about fluctations of the Pound, but enough is enough. Since the referendum we have lost around 100 E every 4 weeks and it's getting worse!
attributes.additional_details:
My husband receives a Basic Pension (85%) and attendance allowance payments 4(weekly) , I receive the married woman's part of his pension.
The first payments after  the referendum were minus 92 Euros and with each subsequent payment the minus has increased. It's shocking. I can supply details if required.

attributes.action: It should be law that the Governor of the Bank of England is a UK Citizen
attributes.background: The UK leads the world in its financial expertise, and there are UK citizens experienced in this field that could do the job, but the position is currently held by a non UK national.

attributes.action: Reduce TV License Fee for full time students living away from home.
attributes.background: Recent introduction of full TV license for students living away from home, even for iPlayer is nonsensical as it will be ignored, not paid and cannot be policed.  A more pragmatic approach would be to have a nominal fee (eg £10) where students can provide parental details of cover at home address.

attributes.action: Make Wildlife/ natural history a compulsory part of the national curriculum
attributes.background: Wildlife around the globe is decreasing at a ferocious rate, not just oversea but on our very own soil. By educating generations about the value of wildlife, the ecosystem and what animals do for us, only then will the world halt the decline in our amazing Wildlife.
attributes.additional_details:
An audit of more than 200 native species - including birds, bats, moths, butterflies, hares and dormice - shows that priority species have declined on average by 58% since 1970 - The guardian

 “The natural world is in serious trouble and it needs our help as never before.”  Sir David Attenborough

attributes.action: Have one NHS distribution centre and buying in bulk whilst making cheaper deals.
attributes.background: We need to have one NHS distribution centre sending all the medical equipment and medicines to each individual hospital. Buying in bulk,getting better and more controled deals. Stoping different hospitals paying different prices,hopefully saving millions. The NHS deserves a better deal,and so do we!

attributes.action: Stop forcing English Standard on Young Deaf children
attributes.background: Make English more accessible for Deaf People (e.g. for us not to be forced to achieve English at C grade standard) each classes should have specialist tutor (e.g. Teacher of Deaf and being taught in small groups) Deaf people should not being stopped progressing from achieving a C grade or above
attributes.additional_details: English is our second language, as we find English so hard to understand! which is why we use Sign Language which has a different structure and no written language. We need to stop feeling like we are being forced to learn English at C grade Standard and it is important that we taught English in a way that is accessible to us.

attributes.action: Allow heating in education to be on in all colder months through more funding
attributes.background: I myself am a student of 16 with asthma. Throught my whole time in education I , along with all my peers , have suffered through the lack of heating. Simply wrapping up warm doesn't work, as breathing in cold air causes illnesses , leading to absents. Please help change this.

attributes.action: Provide Education Staff with Statutory guidance in the use of force in Schools.
attributes.background: In the UK there is no Statutory Guidance for the use of force for Education staff to ensure their Safety. The Guidance published by the Department of Education is non Statutory, this is placing education staff in dangerous situations as they are unsure what action they can take to protect themselves
attributes.additional_details: Under the Health and Safety act 2005 section 8, "Every employer shall ensure, so far as is reasonably practicable, the safety, health and welfare at work of his or her employees." It is officially recognised by the HSE that the Education sector is a occupation that comes into contact with violence in the workplace. They have published guidance in the measures to be taken to reduce this. DofE guidance is not statutory and this means staff are being put at risk as they are unsure what to do

attributes.action: Rebuild concorde as a bomber for RAF
attributes.background: We have no heavy bombers just jets and would be cheap as all ready have Airframe and Concorde is a great plane and supersonic .We can develope it to handle all bombs  .Great Britain needs to help the RAF get their heavy bomber
attributes.additional_details: Type RAF planes active duty your see no heavy bombers .We can not fight a large ground war without heavy bombers on our own if Europe falls

attributes.action: Change the funding for preschool so that all children start at age 3.
attributes.background: It is unfair that children who are born at the "wrong time"  miss out on schooling. Children who are born after term start dates have to wait till the next term to start school, meaning that a child who was born just before the term will benefit from funding while a child born after misses out.
attributes.additional_details: It should be that all children should get funding when they turn 3, regardless of term dates.

attributes.action: Stop tax exiles from claiming government subsidies of any sort
attributes.background:
If anyone chooses to be a tax exile and not pay their fair share of tax to the British people then they should be excluded from the tax system completely, this  should include receiving any form of taxpayers money
If they wish to opt out of the system they should opt out completely

attributes.action: Repeal of the Vagrancy Act of 1824.
attributes.background: This act declares it a criminal act to sleep on the streets or to beg, hence making homelessness a crime.
attributes.additional_details:
The number of cases brought to court under the 1824 Vagrancy Act has surged by 70%, prompting concerns that cuts to support services and benefits are pushing more people to resort to begging. (2009)

https://www.theguardian.com/society/2014/nov/30/begging-prosecutions-increase-england-wales

attributes.action: Ensure that students from year7 are taught in schools how to detect child abuse.
attributes.background: We're a group of students that believe that child abuse needs to be reduced. We have found astonishing figures that kids 4 years old and under are most affected. Most kids that have been physically, verbally or sexually abused are unaware that they are being abused as they don't understand the signs
attributes.additional_details:
Approximately 5 children die every day because of child abuse and 1 out of 3 girls and 1 out of 5 boys will be sexually abused before they reach age 18.
For every child identified as needing protection from abuse, another 8 are suffering alone

attributes.action: Decrease the required number of signatures for a debate by 10,000
attributes.background: With a gap of 90,000 signatures between an out-ruling response and a fair debate, there are becoming unacceptable amounts of valid opinions on law and rights shared by thousands upon thousands, which don't get a look in. Shredding this by a mere 10,000 is reasonable in context.

attributes.action: Vehicle tax (Road Fund Licence) per day, not month
attributes.background: Following the changes in vehicle tax, vehicle owners are now forced to surrender the value of the vehicle tax up until the end of the month in which they sell the vehicle.
attributes.additional_details:
Vehicle buyers are also forced to buy a full month, when they will not have had the use of the days preceeding the vehicle purchase.

It is also the case that the computer systems which coordinate the purchase of vehicle tax are given a concentrated workload at the end of each month. This has recently resulted in the service being unavailable.

I propose that vehicle tax should be available daily so that buyers and sellers are not short-changed, and that the systems are more able to cope with a more uniform demand.

This petition is of interest to anyone in the UK who will either buy or sell a motor vehicle.

Please rectify this unfair practice.

attributes.action: Require proposed Great Reform Bill to give Parliament a veto on terms of BREXIT.
attributes.background: A repeal bill has been proposed to enable BREXIT, as of the date BREXIT takes effect. We propose this bill contain provisions for a Parliamentary vote or referendum approving the terms of BREXIT, and that for the purposes of the Act BREXIT shall not take effect until such approval has been given.
attributes.additional_details: We the people have the undisputed right, per the 2016 referendum to leave the EU. If the terms of leaving are unacceptable, it should neither be disputed that we have the right to change our minds. While it appears the Prime Minister intents to trigger article 50 without Parliamentary consent or knowledge of a likely deal, Parliament and the people can be given a say by the mechanism described above. The Act means the proposed Great Repeal Bill referred to by Mrs May in Conference on 02/10/2016.

attributes.action: All cyclists to have a basic third party insurance cover.
attributes.background: There are more and more people using bicycles these days and accidents happen. So what happens when a cyclist hits you or your vehicle and the blame is no them? Nothing because they are an uninsured vehicle, It's time for change.

attributes.action: To Exempt Final Year Uni students From Council Tax, For Their Entire Tenancy.
attributes.background: The government demand that final year Uni students pay council tax for the period between the conclusion of final term right up until the end of your tenancy. This is regardless of the length of your contract (often demanded by landlords to be 11 months) and the fact that you signed it as a student.
attributes.additional_details: My housemates and I feel we were not sufficiently warned or provided any clear statements to make us aware of this law and feel that either this approach must be changed, or that the demand for council tax over these outlying months, be removed completely. We want to help raise awareness for other students so that they don't get caught out too. As graduates we don't earn too much straight after University and to be suddenly hit with a bill that we were unaware of is quite stressful.

attributes.action: Pressure NICE to sort out the funding for Bisphosphonates for breast cancer.
attributes.background: Thousands of women are potentially missing out on taking these inexpensive drugs because of the lack of national guidance on who should fund them. It is not clear whether the hospital trust, the local clinical commissioning group (CCG) or NHS England central funding should be paying for them.

attributes.action: Drones need unique reg number created by manufacturer which is assigned to buyer
attributes.background:
Problem is there is currently no way of matching a Drone with an owner.

Worse case was a Drone which collided with a British Airway flight over Heathrow. Story covered on 18th April, 2016 - Daily Telegraph
attributes.additional_details:
Daily Telegraph

http://www.telegraph.co.uk/technology/2016/04/18/drone-laws-in-the-uk--what-are-the-rules/

BBC

http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-35442130
